{}.response: This API provides a comprehensive list of physical quantities which are fundamental concepts in the science of physics. Physical quantities are properties of physical systems that can be quantified, meaning they can be measured and expressed by a numerical value. These quantities include, but are not limited to, length, mass, time, current, temperature, amount of substance, and luminous intensity. Each of these physical quantities can be defined based on specific measurement standards and are essential for expressing laws of physics in a measurable form. Length, for instance, can be expressed in meters (m), a standard unit in the International System of Units (SI). Mass can be measured in kilograms (kg), time in seconds (s), current in amperes (A), temperature in kelvins (K), the amount of substance in moles (mol), and luminous intensity in candelas (cd). These quantities form the base for deriving more complex physical concepts and enable scientists and engineers to communicate fundamental measurements universally.
